data.title: FREE BIRTHDAY DRINK WAS NOT FREE
data.text:
Received a coupon for a FREE beverage any size for my birthday. I printed the coupon off of my computer. 

I submitted the coupon to the female employee at the drive-thru. She couldn't scan it through the register. She told me that I had to re-print it larger so the code showed up better...... Really?  The actual coupon I gave her was already half the size of a normal piece of paper: 5 1/2 by 11.....okay.........she had already handed me the large prepared drink with lots of whipped cream on the top. It cost $3.79 plus tax.

The female handed over my coupon to another employee. This time a male. He also tried to scan it into the register - NO luck.

I stupidly offered to pay for the FREE large Birthday drink?  Why in the world did I do that? NO answer.  Three guesses what happened?  They accepted my money.
Yes, I actually paid for the drink.......why didn't I give it back to them & leave?
         
While driving home from Dunkin Donuts I began getting angry - saying to myself:
What just happened?  Why did I foolishly pay for the FREE DRINK? It wasn't my fault they couldn't perform their job properly.  I gave them a legitimate coupon. My driver's license was available if they wanted to see it - although they shouldn't ask for that either.

I pulled my SUV over & called the same Donkin Donuts restaurant on the phone.
The phone # was on the receipt. The same female drive-thru employee answered. 
I politely told her that she should NOT have made me pay for the FREE Birthday drink. That it wasn't the right thing to do.....oh, yeah, she said she'd take off 10% so the damage wouldn't seem to bad......guess what?  I am already a senior citizen.
I should have gotten that 10% anyway.  OMG!!!  This means Dunkin Donuts gave me NOTHING but aggravation.  (well, I'll be fair & state that the large Collette drink with whipped cream is delicious!)
 
I asked the female store employee for the Donkin Donut's Headquarters phone #.
She said she didn't have it....yeah, right!.  She then said, "YOU CAN GOOGLE IT".   
(Why don't YOU google it yourself, young lady?)   Soooo, I get ripped off, am forced to investigate where to file a complaint & demand money back....nice birthday.

 pulled my car over, searched the web for Dunkin Donuts Headquarters. Thank God someone answered. I filed a complaint. The female employee apologized, looked up my e-mail & sent me another FREE coupon for any size drink on my computer.
Phew!!!   Thank you. It was the right thing to do.

data.title: What can one say...great donuts
data.text: Visited with four friends for coffee and donuts.  We were treated very well, service great, no hurry to get us out of there and good donuts.

data.title: quick and fresh
data.text: love DD no matter where we are, and I don't understand why you must have 100 characters, this always annoys me

data.title: Dunkin Dunuts, what do you expect?
data.text:
The only thing I eat there are whole wheat bagels.
Deep fried food is like eating poison for your arteries.
Coffee does not compare to places like Starbucks.
It is clean and they are nice.

data.title: It's time to make the donuts
data.text: Located on an extremely busy corner downtown.   Entering and exiting the parking lot proves exceptionally challenging.   Donuts are always fresh and many varieties from which to choose.   Parking lot too small for long drive-in window.   Safety hazard with cars.   Very small parking area.   Access challenging.   Donuts delicious.

data.title: Best donuts & coffee
data.text: What you see is what you get. Great atmosphere, good service with a smile. And of course the great coffee & donuts. I know drink Dunkin' Donuts at home.

data.title: Refreshing Iced Coffee
data.text: From the the time we walked in it was refreshing! Created by a pleasant staff! Order was correct! Iced coffee awesome, place was clean , bathrooms clean! Our favorite dunkin donut in town! Parking a bit tight

data.title: Always good food
data.text:
Dunkin has been around for many years, and the donuts are always hot and fresh.  Nothing new here, and who hasn't has one of their donuts or coffee at some point?

My only complaint for this particular location is that they are extremely difficult to get in/out of in the mornings.  The rest of the day is fine, but during the morning rush, be prepared for a mess.
